## Developer Guide

If you are new to using `nbdev` here are some useful pointers to get you
started.

### Install junco_sync in Development mode

``` sh
# make sure junco_sync package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to junco_sync
$ nbdev_prepare
```

## Usage

### Installation

Install latest from the GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/cooper-richason/junco-sync):

``` sh
$ pip install git+https://github.com/cooper-richason/junco-sync.git
```

or from [conda](https://anaconda.org/cooper-richason/junco-sync)

``` sh
$ conda install -c cooper-richason junco_sync
```

or from [pypi](https://pypi.org/project/junco-sync/)

``` sh
$ pip install junco_sync
```

### Documentation

Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/cooper-richason/junco-sync)’s
[pages](https://cooper-richason.github.io/junco-sync/). Additionally you
can find package manager specific guidelines on
[conda](https://anaconda.org/cooper-richason/junco-sync) and
[pypi](https://pypi.org/project/junco-sync/) respectively.
